item.description:
Presentation Writer (Beta)

by Markdown Preview Enhanced
powered by reveal.js

press ? key to see keyboard help.


press s key to open note window.

You can easily create beautiful presentation by running command

Markdown Preview Enhanced: Insert New Slide

Pretty cool haha ;)

Just like this

The style of the presentation is consistent with the style of your beloved Atom.

const さかもと = 'cool cooler coolest'

You can change your presentation theme very easily:

All features of Markdown Preview Enhanced are supported.
Such as Math typesetting, mermaid graph, code chunk etc…

$$ f(x) = \int_{-\infty}^\infty \hat f(\xi)\,e^{2 \pi i \xi x} \,d\xi $$

You can set initialization config for your presentation.
Just add front-matter to your presentation markdown file.

---
presentation:
  width: 800
  height: 600
  controls: false
---

More information about front-matter settings can be found here.

Speaker notes is also supported.
Press the s key on your keyboard to open the notes window.

To enable speaker notes, set front-matter as:

---
presentation:
  enableSpeakerNotes: true
---

To add notes, simply set data-notes property:

<!-- slide data-notes:"Write your note here" -->

check Reveal.js Speaker Notes section for more information.

By default, all slides are aligned horizontally, but you can also create vertical slides by adding vertical:true.
For example:

<!-- slide vertical:true -->

You just discovered a vertical slide!

You can set slide background very easily.
For example:

<!-- slide data-background-color:"#ff0000" -->

Of course you can do more about slide background.
Image Background | Atribute | Default | Description |
|—|—|—|
| data-background-image | | URL of the image to show. GIFs restart when the slide opens.|
| data-background-size | cover | See background-size on MDN.|
| data-background-position| center |See background-position on MDN.|
|data-background-repeat |no-repeat |See background-repeat on MDN.|

You can also set video background and iframe background.
Please note that video background doesn’t work in preview | Attribute | Default | Description | |—|—|—| | data-background-video | | A single video source, or a comma separated list of video sources. | |data-background-video-loop|false|Flags if the video should play repeatedly.| |data-background-video-muted|false|Flags if the audio should be muted.| |data-background-iframe||Embeds a web page as a background. |

For example, the markdown snippet below will generate slide like…

<!-- slide data-background-image:"http://ooo.0o0.ooo/2016/10/27/581167987ec08.jpg" data-transition:"zoom" -->
<p style="color: #fff;">国漫大法好！</p>
<p style="color: #fff;">国漫大法好！</p>
<p style="color: #fff;">国漫大法好！</p>

国漫大法好！

国漫大法好！

国漫大法好！

It is also very easy to customize presentation css.
Run Markdown Preview Enhanced: Customize Css command,
then edit section:

.preview-slides .slide,
&[data-presentation-mode] {
  // eg
  // background-color: #000;
}

You can check your presentation in browser by
right clicking at the preview, then choose Open in Browser option.

Markdown Preview Enhanced can also generate beautiful HTML or PDF files for your presentation.

Star this project if you like it ;)

  • Github Repository can be found here
  • Feel free to post issues and request new features here
  • Source code of this presentation can be found here, raw

<!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <title>slides</title> <meta charset="utf-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">

/*********************************************

/*********************************************

.reveal.convex .slides > section > section:not([data-transition]).future {

          transform: translate3d(0, 300px, 0) rotateX(-70deg) translate3d(0, 300px, 0); }

/*********************************************
 * CONCAVE TRANSITION
 *********************************************/
.reveal .slides section[data-transition=concave].stack,
.reveal.concave .slides section.stack {
  -webkit-transform-style: preserve-3d;

.reveal .slides > section[data-transition=concave].past,

.reveal.concave .slides > section:not([data-transition]).future {
  -webkit-transform: translate3d(100%, 0, 0) rotateY(-90deg) translate3d(100%, 0, 0);
          transform: translate3d(100%, 0, 0) rotateY(-90deg) translate3d(100%, 0, 0); }

.reveal .slides > section > section[data-transition=concave].past,
.reveal .slides > section > section[data-transition~=concave-out].past,
.reveal.concave .slides > section > section:not([data-transition]).past {
  -webkit-transform: translate3d(0, -80%, 0) rotateX(-70deg) translate3d(0, -80%, 0);
          transform: translate3d(0, -80%, 0) rotateX(-70deg) translate3d(0, -80%, 0); }

.reveal .slides > section > section[data-transition=concave].future,
.reveal .slides > section > section[data-transition~=concave-in].future,
.reveal.concave .slides > section > section:not([data-transition]).future {
  -webkit-transform: translate3d(0, 80%, 0) rotateX(70deg) translate3d(0, 80%, 0);
          transform: translate3d(0, 80%, 0) rotateX(70deg) translate3d(0, 80%, 0); }

/*********************************************
 * ZOOM TRANSITION
 *********************************************/
.reveal .slides section[data-transition=zoom],
.reveal.zoom .slides section:not([data-transition]) {
  -webkit-transition-timing-function: ease;
          transition-timing-function: ease; }

.reveal .slides > section[data-transition=zoom].past,
.reveal .slides > section[data-transition~=zoom-out].past,
.reveal.zoom .slides > section:not([data-transition]).past {
  visibility: hidden;
  -webkit-transform: scale(16);
          transform: scale(16); }

.reveal .slides > section[data-transition=zoom].future,

/*********************************************
 * PLAYBACK COMPONENT
 *********************************************/
.reveal .playback {

  -webkit-transition: all 400ms ease;
          transition: all 400ms ease; }

.reveal.overview .playback {
  opacity: 0;
  visibility: hidden; }

/*********************************************
 * ROLLING LINKS
 *********************************************/
.reveal .roll {

  line-height: 1.2;
  overflow: hidden;
  vertical-align: top;
  -webkit-perspective: 400px;
          perspective: 400px;
  -webkit-perspective-origin: 50% 50%;
          perspective-origin: 50% 50%; }

.reveal .roll:hover {
  background: none;
  text-shadow: none; }

.reveal .roll span {
  display: block;

  padding: 0 2px;

  -webkit-transition: all 400ms ease;

.reveal .roll:hover span {

.reveal .roll span:after {

  left: 0;
  top: 0;
  padding: 0 2px;
  -webkit-backface-visibility: hidden;

  -webkit-transform-origin: 50% 0%;

  -webkit-transform: translate3d(0px, 110%, 0px) rotateX(-90deg);
          transform: translate3d(0px, 110%, 0px) rotateX(-90deg); }

/*********************************************

 *********************************************/
.reveal aside.notes {
  display: none; }

.reveal .speaker-notes {

  line-height: 1.4;
  color: #fff;
  background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);

  box-sizing: border-box;
  text-align: left;

.reveal .speaker-notes.visible:not(:empty) {

@media screen and (max-width: 1024px) {
  .reveal .speaker-notes {
    font-size: 14px; } }

@media screen and (max-width: 600px) {

/*********************************************

.zoomed .reveal .roll span:after {
  visibility: hidden; }

 </style> <script type="text/x-mathjax-config"> MathJax.Hub.Config({ messageStyle: 'none', tex2jax: {inlineMath: [["$", "$"]], displayMath: [["$$", "$$"]], processEscapes: true} }); </script> <script type="text/javascript" async src="file:///Users/chengjun/.atom/packages/markdown-preview-enhanced/dependencies/mathjax/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS_CHTML"></script> <script src='file:////Users/chengjun/.atom/packages/markdown-preview-enhanced/dependencies/reveal/lib/js/head.min.js'></script> <script src='file:////Users/chengjun/.atom/packages/markdown-preview-enhanced/dependencies/reveal/js/reveal.js'></script> </head> <body class="markdown-preview-enhanced " data-use-github-style data-use-github-syntax-theme data-presentation-mode> <div class="reveal">
  <div class="slides">
    <section  data-notes='Congrats! You just opened speaker notes'><h1 class="sync-line" data-line="9" id="presentation-writer-beta">Presentation Writer (Beta)</h1>
<p class="sync-line" data-line="10">by <strong>Markdown Preview Enhanced</strong>  <br>
powered by <a href="https://github.com/hakimel/reveal.js">reveal.js</a>  <br>
<br></p>
<p style="font-size: 18px;">press <kbd>?</kbd> key to see keyboard help.</p>
<p style="font-size: 18px;">press <kbd>s</kbd> key to open note window.</p>
</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="17">You can easily create beautiful presentation by running command<br>
<center> <code>Markdown Preview Enhanced: Insert New Slide</code> </center></p>
<aside class="notes">
    Pretty cool haha ;)
</aside>
</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="24">Just like this</p>
<p class="sync-line" data-line="26"><img src="http://ooo.0o0.ooo/2016/07/17/578c61408dd73.gif" alt="presentation"></p>
</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="29">The style of the presentation is consistent with the style of your beloved <strong>Atom</strong>.</p>
<pre class="editor-colors lang-javascript sync-line" data-line="30"><div class="line"><span class="source js"><span class="storage type const js"><span>const</span></span><span> さかもと </span><span class="keyword operator assignment js"><span>=</span></span><span> </span><span class="string quoted single js"><span class="punctuation definition string begin js"><span>'</span></span><span>cool cooler coolest</span><span class="punctuation definition string end js"><span>'</span></span></span></span></div></pre>
</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="35">You can change your presentation theme very easily:</p>
<p class="sync-line" data-line="37"><img src="https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1908863/23577767/951531b2-008d-11e7-95d0-08cd53d277a6.gif" alt="presentation-theme"></p>
</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="41">All features of <strong>Markdown Preview Enhanced</strong> are supported.<br>
Such as Math typesetting, mermaid graph, code chunk etc...<br>
<br><br>
$$f(x) = \int_{-\infty}^\infty    \hat f(\xi)\,e^{2 \pi i \xi x}    \,d\xi$$</p>
</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="51">You can set initialization config for your presentation.<br>
Just add front-matter to your presentation markdown file.</p>
<pre class="editor-colors lang-yaml sync-line" data-line="53"><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span class="punctuation definition directives end yaml"><span>---</span></span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span class="entity name tag yaml"><span>presentation</span><span class="punctuation separator key-value yaml"><span>:</span></span></span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span>  </span><span class="entity name tag yaml"><span>width</span><span class="punctuation separator key-value yaml"><span>:</span></span></span><span> </span><span class="constant numeric yaml"><span>800</span></span><span> </span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span>  </span><span class="entity name tag yaml"><span>height</span><span class="punctuation separator key-value yaml"><span>:</span></span></span><span> </span><span class="constant numeric yaml"><span>600</span></span><span> </span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span>  </span><span class="entity name tag yaml"><span>controls</span><span class="punctuation separator key-value yaml"><span>:</span></span></span><span> </span><span class="constant language yaml"><span>false</span></span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span class="punctuation definition directives end yaml"><span>---</span></span></span></div></pre>
<p class="sync-line" data-line="61">More information about front-matter settings can be found <a href="https://github.com/shd101wyy/markdown-preview-enhanced/blob/master/docs/presentation-front-matter.md">here</a>.</p>
</section><section  data-notes='This is speaker note'><p class="sync-line" data-line="64"><strong>Speaker notes</strong> is also supported.<br>
Press the <kbd>s</kbd> key on your keyboard to open the notes window.</p>
<p class="sync-line" data-line="67">To enable speaker notes, set front-matter as:</p>
<pre class="editor-colors lang-yaml sync-line" data-line="68"><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span class="punctuation definition directives end yaml"><span>---</span></span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span class="entity name tag yaml"><span>presentation</span><span class="punctuation separator key-value yaml"><span>:</span></span></span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span>  </span><span class="entity name tag yaml"><span>enableSpeakerNotes</span><span class="punctuation separator key-value yaml"><span>:</span></span></span><span> </span><span class="constant language yaml"><span>true</span></span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="source yaml"><span class="punctuation definition directives end yaml"><span>---</span></span></span></div></pre>
<p class="sync-line" data-line="74">To add notes, simply set <code>data-notes</code> property:</p>
<pre class="editor-colors lang-html sync-line" data-line="75"><div class="line"><span class="text html basic"><span class="comment block html"><span class="punctuation definition comment html"><span><!--</span></span><span> slide data-notes:"Write your note here" </span><span class="punctuation definition comment html"><span>--></span></span></span></span></div></pre>
<p class="sync-line" data-line="78">check <a href="https://github.com/hakimel/reveal.js#speaker-notes">Reveal.js Speaker Notes</a> section for more information.</p>
</section><section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="82">By default, all slides are aligned horizontally, but you can also create vertical slides by adding <code>vertical:true</code>.<br>
For example:</p>
<pre class="editor-colors lang-html sync-line" data-line="84"><div class="line"><span class="text html basic"><span class="comment block html"><span class="punctuation definition comment html"><span><!--</span></span><span> slide vertical:true </span><span class="punctuation definition comment html"><span>--></span></span></span></span></div></pre>
</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="89">You just discovered a vertical slide!</p>
</section></section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="92">You can set slide background very easily.<br>
For example:</p>
<pre class="editor-colors lang-html sync-line" data-line="94"><div class="line"><span class="text html basic"><span class="comment block html"><span class="punctuation definition comment html"><span><!--</span></span><span> slide data-background-color:"#ff0000" </span><span class="punctuation definition comment html"><span>--></span></span></span></span></div></pre>
</section><section  data-background-color='#ffebcf'><p class="sync-line" data-line="99">Of course you can do more about slide background.<br>
<strong>Image Background</strong></p>
<table>
<thead>
<tr><th>Atribute</th><th>Default</th><th>Description</th></tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr><td>data-background-image</td><td></td><td>URL of the image to show. GIFs restart when the slide opens.</td></tr>
<tr><td>data-background-size</td><td>cover</td><td>See <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/background-size">background-size</a> on MDN.</td></tr>
<tr><td>data-background-position</td><td>center</td><td>See <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/background-position">background-position</a> on MDN.</td></tr>
<tr><td>data-background-repeat</td><td>no-repeat</td><td>See <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/background-repeat">background-repeat</a> on MDN.</td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="109">You can also set <strong>video background</strong> and <strong>iframe background</strong>.<br>
<em>Please note that video background doesn't work in preview</em></p>
<table>
<thead>
<tr><th>Attribute</th><th>Default</th><th>Description</th></tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr><td>data-background-video</td><td></td><td>A single video source, or a comma separated list of video sources.</td></tr>
<tr><td>data-background-video-loop</td><td>false</td><td>Flags if the video should play repeatedly.</td></tr>
<tr><td>data-background-video-muted</td><td>false</td><td>Flags if the audio should be muted.</td></tr>
<tr><td>data-background-iframe</td><td></td><td>Embeds a web page as a background.</td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="135">It is also very easy to customize presentation css.<br>
Run <code>Markdown Preview Enhanced: Customize Css</code> command,<br>
then edit section:</p>
<pre class="editor-colors lang-less sync-line" data-line="138"><div class="line"><span class="text plain null-grammar"><span>.preview-slides .slide,</span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="text plain null-grammar"><span>&[data-presentation-mode] {</span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="text plain null-grammar"><span>  // eg</span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="text plain null-grammar"><span>  // background-color: #000;</span></span></div><div class="line"><span class="text plain null-grammar"><span>}</span></span></div></pre>
</section><section ><p class="sync-line" data-line="147">You can check your presentation in browser by<br>
right clicking at the preview, then choose <code>Open in Browser</code> option.</p>
